revised_title: The Evolution of Scientific Communication Methods
tldr: This lecture discusses the historical development of scientific communication methods, focusing on the importance of the spoken word and the written document. The author highlights the international character of learning in ancient and medieval times, emphasizing the role of Latin as the language of science. The lecture also touches upon the transition to using native languages and the current dominance of English in scientific communication.
